p: Cryptococcus infection occurred in both immunosuppressed and immunocompetent individuals. Pulmonary cryptococcosis is usually the primary site of a disseminated or central-nervous-system cryptococcal infection that may be fatal [ 46]. Traditionally, capsule-deficient Cryptococcus neoformans was considered to have low virulence. However, a recent study showed that the presentations and outcomes did not differ significantly between patients with proven pulmonary cryptococcosis caused by capsule-deficient Cr. neoformans and six patients with pulmonary cryptococcosis caused by capsule-intact Cr. Neoformans [ 46].
